alert.note: Alert for Codington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 7:56AM MDT until April 22 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue affecting Codington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The lower banks on both sides of the river downstream of the gauge are overtopped, and the lower lying areas along Kampeska Blvd, 4th Ave SW, and Riverside Park on Kemp Ave begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue falling to 9.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
